meanings.definition: Fritzes (verb): to behave erratically or malfunction
meanings.sent1: The old clock fritzes and stops ticking suddenly.
meanings.sent2: The computer fritzes when too many programs are open at once.
meanings.sent3: The robot fritzes and starts dancing randomly on the floor.
meanings.sent4: Her plan fritzes like a broken machine, causing chaos.
meanings.sent5: The car engine fritzes, sputtering and shaking uncontrollably.

meanings.definition: Fritzes (noun): small pieces of broken or crushed material
meanings.sent1: She swept up the fritzes of glass after the vase fell.
meanings.sent2: The path was covered in tiny fritzes of colorful leaves.
meanings.sent3: The artist used fritzes of metal to create a unique sculpture.
meanings.sent4: The beach was scattered with fritzes of seashells, glittering in the sun.
meanings.sent5: The bag contained various fritzes of candy, all mixed together.

meanings.definition: Fritzes (adjective): describing something that is broken or malfunctioning
meanings.sent1: He tried to fix the fritzes toaster but it wouldn't work.
meanings.sent2: The fritzes light bulb flickered before going out completely.
meanings.sent3: The fritzes radio played static instead of music.
meanings.sent4: Her fritzes phone screen showed random lines and colors.
meanings.sent5: The fritzes door handle kept falling off, causing inconvenience.
